item.description:
Hey fellow Boston Volunteers,

 

I want to share a great opportunity with you. Though this is not an official Boston Volunteer event, it's a great local nonprofit that needs your help. You will be helping local seniors and adults with disabilities. Please simply RSVP or contact Nia to learn more.

 

For more than 30 years,  Springwell has provided compassionate and cost effective services to seniors and adults with disabilities to not only help improve the quality of their lives but to enable them to remain independently at home.  In addition to Volunteer Services, Springwell also offers Home Care, Information & Referral, Nutrition Services and Protective Services.  Springwell’s MassHealth programs include Adult/Foster/Family Care (AFC), Group Adult Foster Care (GAFC), Personal Care Attendant (PCA and Senior Care Options (SCO.)

 

Springwell’s philosophy of care is to treat elders and adults with disabilities with dignity and respect and to provide a high quality of service.  Springwell services the towns of  Belmont, Brookline, Newton, Needham, Wellesley Watertown, Waltham, Weston.

 

Springwell’s Volunteer programs are a crucial part of the services Springwell  provides.  The agency proudly has 270 active and committed volunteers.  These volunteers assist in many ways including helping seniors apply for MassHealth and SNAP ( Food Stamps), driving seniors to medical appointments, helping seniors to pay their bills and balance their checkbooks, and offering companionship to isolated seniors.  Whether in direct contact with consumers or assisting with administrative duties in our office, volunteers time and skills are very valuable and make a great impact in the lives of the elders Springwell serves.  For more information about Springwell and the Volunteer Programs, visit www.springwell.com

At this time, we are actively recruiting Benefit Application Volunteers.

 

The Benefit Application Volunteer (BAV) Program was started with a grant from AmeriCorps in 2011. The program is supported by two full-time AmeriCorps Vistas who support, train and coordinate the Benefit Application Volunteers.   These trained volunteers go into the homes of seniors and assist them with completing Mass Health and SNAP(Food Stamps) applications. This is a free service to the elder.  This volunteer based service makes the process of applying for benefits easier for seniors who are applying for benefits and assistance with the application process.    Volunteers will complete initial orientation/training.  Once the volunteer is trained, they will be matched with an elder who is requesting assistance with an application.  This is a great opportunity to help an elder access benefits, and to make a difference in someone’s life!  For more information, please call Nia Higginbotham at 617-926-4100 or email at nhigginbotham@springwell.com

 

The Boston Volunteers
Big enough to deliver, small enough to care
Learn more: www.BostonVolunteer.org

Learn more about your fellow Boston Volunteers:

group.name: Boston Volunteers. Big enough 2 deliver, small enough 2 care

item.name: Helping seniors in our community with Springwell
